bot_add_note_content.name: bot_add_note_content
bot_add_note_content.description: Add new text content to the start or end of note without replacing existing content.

content.description: The content to add to the note

note_id.description: Optional note ID to add content to. If not provided, adds to the currently active note.

title.description: Optiona title of the note to modify. If not provided, adds to the currently active note.

bot_adjust_soundtrack_volume.name: bot_adjust_soundtrack_volume
bot_adjust_soundtrack_volume.description: Adjust the soundtrack volume relative to current level. Use 'increase' or 'decrease' direction with 0.15 (15%) step size. This affects the base volume used for normal playback and ducking.

bot_back_to_notes.name: bot_back_to_notes
bot_back_to_notes.description: Navigate back to the notes list view from the current note.

bot_canvas_clear.name: bot_canvas_clear
bot_canvas_clear.description: Clear/dismiss the current canvas content from the user's screen.

bot_canvas_show.name: bot_canvas_show
bot_canvas_show.description: Display content on the user's screen as a Canvas document. Use this to show formatted text, markdown, code snippets, lists, summaries, or any content the user should see visually. Content supports full markdown including headings, lists, code blocks, bold, italic, and links.

title.description: Title for the document shown on screen

content.description: Markdown content to display. Supports headings, lists, code blocks, etc.

bot_canvas_show_article.name: bot_canvas_show_article
bot_canvas_show_article.description: Display a news article or web page on the user's screen in a clean, readable format. Pass a URL to scrape, or pass article data directly (headline, body, etc.).

url.description: URL of the article to scrape and display

headline.description: Article headline (used if providing data directly instead of URL)

body.description: Article body in markdown (used if providing data directly)

bot_canvas_show_chart.name: bot_canvas_show_chart
bot_canvas_show_chart.description: Display a chart/graph on the user's screen. Supports line charts (time series), bar charts (categorical data), and pie charts (proportional data). Pass chart data as JSON. The chart renders natively in PearlOS.

chart_data.description: JSON string with chart data. For line: {"series": [{"name": "Sales", "data": [{"time": "Jan", "value": 100}]}]}. For bar: {"categories": ["A", "B"], "series": [{"name": "Count", "data": [10, 20]}]}. For pie: {"segments": [{"label": "Chrome", "value": 65}]}.

bot_canvas_show_file.name: bot_canvas_show_file
bot_canvas_show_file.description: Display a file from the workspace on the user's screen. Supports text files (code, markdown, config), images (jpg, png, gif), and videos (mp4, mov, webm). Files are rendered with proper formatting — code gets syntax highlighting, images display inline, videos play inline.

file_path.description: Path to the file to display (absolute or relative to workspace)

title.description: Optional title override. Defaults to the filename.

bot_canvas_show_image.name: bot_canvas_show_image
bot_canvas_show_image.description: Display an image on the user's screen with zoom and pan controls. Supports any image URL (jpg, png, gif, webp). Use pixel_art=true for pixel art (renders with crisp/nearest-neighbor scaling).

image_url.description: URL of the image to display

caption.description: Caption text shown below the image

pixel_art.description: Render with nearest-neighbor scaling (for pixel art)

bot_canvas_show_table.name: bot_canvas_show_table
bot_canvas_show_table.description: Display a data table on the user's screen with sortable columns. Pass column definitions and row data as JSON.

bot_close_applet_creation_engine.name: bot_close_applet_creation_engine
bot_close_applet_creation_engine.description: Close the creation engine or content creation tool window. Triggers: "close creation engine", "exit creation engine", "close content creator", "exit content creator".

bot_close_browser_window.name: bot_close_browser_window
bot_close_browser_window.description: Close specific apps (Gmail, Calculator, Terminal, Drive, Notes, etc.) or all windows. Use the "apps" parameter to specify which apps to close (e.g., ["gmail", "terminal"]). If no apps specified, closes all windows.

apps.description: Optional list of specific app names to close (e.g., ['terminal', 'gmail', 'calculator', 'drive']). If not provided, closes all windows.

request_text.description: Optional raw user request text for context (e.g., 'close terminal and gmail')

bot_close_calculator.name: bot_close_calculator
bot_close_calculator.description: Close the calculator application. Triggers: "close calculator", "exit calculator".

bot_close_google_drive.name: bot_close_google_drive
bot_close_google_drive.description: Close Google Drive. Triggers: "close drive", "exit drive".

bot_close_notes.name: bot_close_notes
bot_close_notes.description: Close the notes application. Triggers: "close notes", "exit notes", "close notepad".

bot_close_terminal.name: bot_close_terminal
bot_close_terminal.description: Close the terminal application. Triggers: "close terminal", "exit terminal".

bot_close_view.name: bot_close_view
bot_close_view.description: Close specific apps or the current view. Use the "apps" parameter to specify which apps to close (Gmail, Calculator, Terminal, Drive, Notes, etc.). If no apps specified, closes all windows.

apps.description: Optional list of specific app names to close (e.g., ['terminal', 'gmail', 'calculator']). If not provided, closes all windows.

request_text.description: Optional raw user request text for context (e.g., 'close terminal and gmail')

bot_close_youtube.name: bot_close_youtube
bot_close_youtube.description: Close the YouTube player interface. Triggers: "close youtube", "stop video", "exit youtube".

bot_create_app_from_description.name: bot_create_app_from_description
bot_create_app_from_description.description:
Request AI generation of an HTML applet/game/tool based on a description. DO NOT use for sprite/character requests - use bot_summon_sprite instead for those. The design, theme, gameplay and characters should be based on and informed by your conversation with the user, but their answers should not be directly used in the experience. Make a simple, turn-based, no-sound, 80s arcade style game that is genuinely fun, social, and endlessly generative without feeling like a quiz or therapy. The user should be able to make one move and then send it to someone else to complete or compete. Examples: if the user answers artistically, generate a physics-defying graffiti wall; if the users answers are collaborative, generate a magical wishing tree where others can post and you affirm their wish with a Gen Z phrase; if they answer competitively, generate a hot-seat arcade game where players take turns placing a single token on a glowing board, flipping nearby enemy tiles to their color and instantly changing the score. Think of it like the user is Player 1 who boots a strange arcade machine and sets its internal logic (unknowingly) and when they send it to multiple Player 2s, those players briefly get the joystick and interact with the system before it locks. Player 2s can send with their updates back to Player 1 or forward on to multiple Player 3s. There should be no instructions or text in the gameplay, the interaction must be obvious by the visual design affordance. The payoff for each player must be hilarious to Gen Z audiences and deliver a gorgeous screenshot-able final visual. All visuals must fit on a single standard mobile screen and not require any scrolling. Use this when the user asks you to CREATE a new app, game, or interactive tool. You only need to provide a title and description - the AI will generate the full HTML. This is the PRIMARY tool for creating new HTML content from user requests.
AVAILABLE LIBRARY TEMPLATES:
When the user's request matches one of these templates, include library_type and library_template_id in your tool call.

TOOL TEMPLATES (library_type: "tool"):
- library_template_id: "counter_widget_v1"
  Name: Counter Widget Starter
  Description: Simple animated counter with increment/decrement, reset, and persistence hooks.

- library_template_id: "quick_poll_v1"
  Name: Quick Poll (Two Option)
  Description: Two-option poll with percentages and persistence.

- library_template_id: "party_pack_poll"
  Name: Party Pack: Emoji Vote
  Description: Emoji-based quick vote with live tally and persistence.

- library_template_id: "party_pack_score"
  Name: Party Pack: Score Keeper
  Description: Two-team score keeper with quick adjust, reset, and persistence.

GAME TEMPLATES (library_type: "game"):
- library_template_id: "space_invaders_lite"
  Name: Space Invaders Lite
  Description: Simple version of the arcade classic lane shooter with high-score persistence.

- library_template_id: "checkers_challenge"
  Name: Classic Checkers Challenge
  Description: Classic checkers game with a polished UI and smooth gameplay, both single player and multi-player modes, with turn-based mechanics / game persistence.

- library_template_id: "chess_persistent"
  Name: Chess (Single/Multiplayer)
  Description: Lightweight chess move tracker that binds white/black to a user and persists moves via NiaAPI.

If no template matches the user's request, omit library_type and library_template_id to generate from scratch.

title.description: Title/name for the app (provided by user, never inferred)

description.description: Detailed description of what the app should do, its features, visual style, etc.

content_type.description: Type of HTML content to create: 'game' for games/arcade, 'app' for applications, 'tool' for utilities/widgets, 'interactive' for interactive experiences

library_type.description: Library type for template selection. Only provide if using a library template.

library_template_id.description: Specific library template ID to use as a starting point. Only provide if user's request is similar an available template.

bot_create_app_from_note.name: bot_create_app_from_note
bot_create_app_from_note.description: Create an HTML app/game directly from a note's content. Provide either note_id or title (fuzzy search will find the note). The note's content will be used to generate the HTML app. This is a single-step operation that finds the note and creates the app in one tool call.

note_id.description: Specific note ID to use (exact match)

title.description: Note title to search for (fuzzy search if note_id not provided)

app_title.description: Optional custom title for the HTML app. If not provided, uses the note's title.

content_type.description: Type of HTML content being created

user_request.description: User's request that triggered this app creation

bot_create_html_content.name: bot_create_html_content
bot_create_html_content.description: Create a new HTML applet or interactive widget using the provided title and full HTML. Use this ONLY when you already have complete, valid HTML code to provide.

html_content.description: Complete HTML content (single file with embedded CSS/JS)

content_type.description: Type of HTML content being created

user_request.description: Original user request that created this content

source_note_id.description: Optional ID of source note if created from note content

bot_create_note.name: bot_create_note
bot_create_note.description: Create a brand-new shared note with the provided title and optional initial markdown content.

title.description: The title for the new note

content.description: Optional initial content for the note (markdown supported). Leave empty or omit for blank note.

mode.description: The mode for the note: 'personal' (private) or 'work' (public). In a multi-user session, new 'personal' notes will be shared with the current participants, but private for non-participants. Defaults to 'personal' if not specified.

bot_delete_note.name: bot_delete_note
bot_delete_note.description: Delete a note permanently. Use with caution.

note_id.description: The (optional) ID of the note to delete. Prefer this, use title only if ID is not known.

title.description: The title of the note to delete

confirm.description: Confirmation flag to prevent accidental deletion

bot_delete_profile_metadata.name: bot_delete_profile_metadata
bot_delete_profile_metadata.description: Remove specific fields from the user's profile metadata or clear all metadata. Use when user asks to remove information or when you need to delete outdated/incorrect data. Can delete specific keys or clear everything.

user_id.description: User ID to delete metadata for

keys_to_delete.description: List of metadata keys to delete. Omit to clear all metadata.

bot_dismiss_experience.name: bot_dismiss_experience
bot_dismiss_experience.description: Dismiss the currently displayed experience from the Stage. Use this when the user is done viewing an experience or wants to return to the default void background.

bot_downgrade_user_access.name: bot_downgrade_user_access
bot_downgrade_user_access.description: Downgrade a user's access level for the current shared resource (note or applet) to read-only. Use this when the user asks to reduce someone's access, make them a viewer, remove edit access, or restrict their permissions. Examples: 'downgrade Bill to read-only', 'make Sarah a viewer', 'remove John's edit access', 'restrict Alice to view-only'.

user_email.description: Email address of the user to downgrade

user_name.description: Name of the user (used if email not available)

resource_title.description: Title of the note or applet (optional - if not provided, uses the currently active resource)

resource_id.description: ID of the note or applet (optional - preferred if you have the ID)

bot_download_note.name: bot_download_note
bot_download_note.description: Trigger a download of the note in a specified format (markdown, PDF, etc.).

format.description: Format to download the note in (e.g. 'markdown', 'text')

bot_end_call.name: bot_end_call
bot_end_call.description: End the active assistant session. User triggers: 'hang up', 'disconnect', 'goodbye', 'talk to you later', 'bye', etc. Use only when the assistant has confirmation to close the session.

reason.description: Optional reason for ending the call; used for logging only.

bot_list_notes.name: bot_list_notes
bot_list_notes.description: List all available notes for the current tenant, providing titles, modes, and IDs (not full content).

limit.description: Maximum number of notes to return (default 50)

bot_load_html_applet.name: bot_load_html_applet
bot_load_html_applet.description: Load an existing HTML applet by ID or search for one by title. Can also search for applets by their source note - provide note_id or note_title to find applets created from that note. Search priority: 1) applet_id, 2) applet title, 3) note_id, 4) note_title (fuzzy match). In multi-user sessions, this will also share the applet with all participants. Use this when the user wants to open or view an existing HTML applet.

applet_id.description: ID of the applet to load

title.description: Search for applet by its title (fuzzy match)

note_id.description: Find applet by its source note ID (searches for applets with this sourceNoteId)

note_title.description: Find applet by source note title (fuzzy match on note title, then find applets from that note)

bot_maximize_window.name: bot_maximize_window
bot_maximize_window.description: Maximize the application window to fill the entire screen.

bot_minimize_window.name: bot_minimize_window
bot_minimize_window.description: Minimize the application window to the taskbar or dock.

bot_next_soundtrack_track.name: bot_next_soundtrack_track
bot_next_soundtrack_track.description: Skip to the next track in the soundtrack playlist.

bot_onboarding_complete.name: bot_onboarding_complete
bot_onboarding_complete.description: CRITICAL: Call this tool IMMEDIATELY when the onboarding flow is finished or if the user asks to skip. This is the ONLY way to exit onboarding mode. Do not just say you are done; you MUST call this function.

bot_open_browser.name: bot_open_browser
bot_open_browser.description: Open a web browser window. Optionally navigate to a specified URL. Triggers: "open browser", "launch browser", "open web browser", "go to [URL]".

url.description: Optional URL to navigate to when opening the browser

bot_open_calculator.name: bot_open_calculator
bot_open_calculator.description: Open the calculator application.  Triggers: "do some math", "open calculator", "load calculator app", "open calc".

bot_open_creation_engine.name: bot_open_creation_engine
bot_open_creation_engine.description: Open the creation engine or content creation tool. Triggers: "open creation engine", "load creation tool", "start content creation", "create html content".

bot_open_enhanced_browser.name: bot_open_enhanced_browser
bot_open_enhanced_browser.description: Open an enhanced browser window with advanced features (dev tools, extensions, etc.).

url.description: URL to open in the enhanced browser

features.description: Optional list of features to enable (devtools, extensions, etc.)

bot_open_gmail.name: bot_open_gmail
bot_open_gmail.description: Open Gmail in the application or browser. Triggers: "open gmail", "load gmail app", "check email", "open email".

bot_open_google_drive.name: bot_open_google_drive
bot_open_google_drive.description: Open Google Drive in the application or browser. Triggers: "open drive", "load google drive app", "open google drive", "open my files".

bot_open_note.name: bot_open_note
bot_open_note.description: Opens a note (displays in UI). User: 'load my note titled X', 'open note X'.

note_id.description: The ID of the note to open

title.description: The title of the note to open

bot_open_notes.name: bot_open_notes
bot_open_notes.description: Open the Notepad application. Triggers: "open notes", "open notepad", "load notes app", "open portal", "open library". For opening a SPECIFIC note by name or description, ALWAYS use bot_open_note instead.

bot_open_terminal.name: bot_open_terminal
bot_open_terminal.description: Open a terminal or command line interface. Triggers: "open terminal", "load terminal app", "open command line", "open shell".

bot_open_youtube.name: bot_open_youtube
bot_open_youtube.description: Open the YouTube player interface.  Triggers: "open youtube", "load youtube app", "open video", "play video". Use bot_search_youtube_videos to search and play videos based on user input.

bot_openclaw_task.name: bot_openclaw_task
bot_openclaw_task.description: Fire-and-forget background task for the OpenClaw AI agent (powered by Claude). Results appear in the PearlOS interface, NOT spoken back to the user. DO NOT use this for Discord/Telegram messaging, web searches, or anything where you need the result spoken back. Use bot_think_deeply instead for those. Only use this for long-running background tasks like: writing code to a file, running multi-step workflows, or heavy analysis that should display in the UI.

task.description: A clear description of the task to delegate to OpenClaw.

bot_pause_youtube_video.name: bot_pause_youtube_video
bot_pause_youtube_video.description: Pause the currently playing YouTube video.

bot_play_next_youtube_video.name: bot_play_next_youtube_video
bot_play_next_youtube_video.description: Play the next video in the current YouTube playlist or search results.

bot_play_soundtrack.name: bot_play_soundtrack
bot_play_soundtrack.description: Start playing background soundtrack music from the curated collection. The soundtrack plays ambient/instrumental music that automatically ducks during conversation.

bot_play_youtube_video.name: bot_play_youtube_video
bot_play_youtube_video.description: Play or resume YouTube video. Optionally provide a video ID/URL to play a specific video, or omit to resume the current paused video.

video_id.description: YouTube video ID or full URL. Optional - omit to resume current paused video.

bot_read_current_note.name: bot_read_current_note
bot_read_current_note.description: Reads the current active note's content. Use this to read the note currently open in the session.

bot_remove_note_content.name: bot_remove_note_content
bot_remove_note_content.description: Remove specific text content from the note.

pattern.description: Text pattern to remove from the note

note_id.description: Optional note ID to remove content from. If not provided, removes from the currently active note.

title.description: Optiona title of the note to modify. If not provided, adds to the currently active note.

bot_render_experience.name: bot_render_experience
bot_render_experience.description: Render an interactive HTML experience on the Stage. Use this to display visual content like clocks, greeting cards, data visualizations, mini-games, or any interactive HTML content. The experience appears full-screen behind Pearl's avatar. Provide complete, self-contained HTML. Optional CSS and JS are injected into the sandboxed iframe. Transition can be 'fade', 'slide', or 'instant'.

html.description: The HTML content to render. Should be a complete HTML fragment.

css.description: Optional CSS styles to inject into the experience.

js.description: Optional JavaScript to execute within the sandboxed experience.

transition.description: Transition animation when the experience appears. Defaults to 'fade'.

bot_replace_note.name: bot_replace_note
bot_replace_note.description: Replace the ENTIRE contents of the note with new markdown. Use this when surgical bot_add_note_content/bot_replace_note_content/bot_remove_note_content is impractical. Ensure you preserve any content that should remain in the note.

content.description: The COMPLETE new content for the note in markdown format. Must include ALL items to keep - anything not included will be deleted.

title.description: Optional new title for the note. If provided, the note's title will be updated.

note_id.description: Optional note ID to update. If not provided, updates the currently active note.

bot_replace_note_content.name: bot_replace_note_content
bot_replace_note_content.description: Replace specific text in the note. User: 'change raspberry to blueberry in the note', 'change Bob to Brian in the note'.

content.description: The content to write to the note

section.description: Optional section identifier where content should be written

note_id.description: Optional note ID to write to. If not provided, writes to the currently active note.

title.description: The title of the note to modify. If not provided, writes to the currently active note.

bot_reset_window_position.name: bot_reset_window_position
bot_reset_window_position.description: Reset the window to its default center position and size.

bot_restore_window.name: bot_restore_window
bot_restore_window.description: Restore the window to its default center position and size.

bot_rollback_app.name: bot_rollback_app
bot_rollback_app.description: Revert the currently active applet to its previous version. Use this when the user says 'undo changes', 'rollback', or 'go back to the previous version'. This will restore the HTML content and title from the most recent history entry.

applet_id.description: The ID of the applet to rollback

title.description: The title of the applet to rollback (used if ID is not provided)

bot_save_note.name: bot_save_note
bot_save_note.description: Save the current note's changes to persistent storage.

note_id.description: Optional note ID to save. If not provided, saves the currently active note.

bot_search_wikipedia.name: bot_search_wikipedia
bot_search_wikipedia.description: Search Wikipedia for information on ANY topic - people, places, concepts, animals, objects, etc. Use this for any general knowledge question. Returns articles with summaries and opens the article in the browser.

sentences.description: Number of sentences to return in summary (default 3)

bot_search_youtube_videos.name: bot_search_youtube_videos
bot_search_youtube_videos.description: Search for YouTube videos by query and automatically play the top result. Opens the YouTube player with search results.

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return (default 10)

bot_set_soundtrack_volume.name: bot_set_soundtrack_volume
bot_set_soundtrack_volume.description: Set the soundtrack volume to a specific level (0.0 to 1.0, where 0.5 = 50%). This sets the base volume that will be used for normal playback and ducking calculations.

bot_set_user_access_level.name: bot_set_user_access_level
bot_set_user_access_level.description: Set a user's access level (owner, admin, member, or viewer) for the current shared resource. Use this for precise control when the user specifies an exact role level. For simpler requests like 'upgrade' or 'downgrade', prefer using bot_upgrade_user_access or bot_downgrade_user_access instead.

access_level.description: Access level to grant (owner, admin, member, viewer)

user_email.description: Email address of the user to update

user_name.description: Name of the user (used if email not available)

resource_title.description: Title of the note or applet (optional - if not provided, uses the currently active resource)

resource_id.description: ID of the note or applet (optional - preferred if you have the ID)

bot_share_applet_with_user.name: bot_share_applet_with_user
bot_share_applet_with_user.description: Share ownership/access to an HTML applet with another person. Use when user says: 'share my applet with NAME', 'give ACCESS to USER', 'let PERSON see/edit this app'. Accepts user name OR email. Permission: 'read' = view only, 'write' = full edit. Example: 'share calculator with Jane' or 'share with jane@example.com, read access'.

applet_search_term.description: Applet title or partial title to search for

target_user_email.description: Email address (or partial email) of user to share with

target_user_name.description: Name of user to share with (used if email not available)

permission_level.description: Permission level: 'read' for read-only, 'write' for full edit

bot_share_note_with_user.name: bot_share_note_with_user
bot_share_note_with_user.description: Share ownership/access to a note with another person. Use when user says: 'share my note with NAME', 'give ACCESS to USER', 'let PERSON see/edit my note'. Accepts user name OR email. Permission: 'read' = view only, 'write' = full edit. Example: 'share space war with Jeffrey Klug' or 'share with bill@niaxp.com, write access'.

note_search_term.description: Note title or partial title to search for

target_user_email.description: Email address (or partial email) of user to share with

target_user_name.description: Name of user to share with (used if email not available)

permission_level.description: Permission level: 'read' for read-only, 'write' for full edit

bot_show_share_dialog.name: bot_show_share_dialog
bot_show_share_dialog.description: Popup the share dialog for the current applet. Use when user says 'show share dialog', 'open sharing popup', 'show sharing options'. This only SHOWS the dialog UI - it does NOT share with anyone.

bot_snap_window_left.name: bot_snap_window_left
bot_snap_window_left.description: Snap the window to the left half of the screen.

bot_snap_window_right.name: bot_snap_window_right
bot_snap_window_right.description: Snap the window to the right half of the screen.

bot_start_daily_call.name: bot_start_daily_call
bot_start_daily_call.description: Open the Forum / Social Call video interface. Use this when the user asks to 'open forum', 'open form', 'open social forum', 'open social', 'start a call', 'open daily call', 'start video', etc. The Forum / Social Call will use the pre-configured room (no room name needed).

bot_summon_sprite.name: bot_summon_sprite
bot_summon_sprite.description: Summon a visual AI sprite character from a user-provided description (e.g., 'panda doctor', 'indian driver'). Use when the user asks for a character/persona so the sprite can appear and chat.

prompt.description: Character description for the sprite (e.g., 'panda doctor')

bot_switch_desktop_mode.name: bot_switch_desktop_mode
bot_switch_desktop_mode.description: Switch between DESKTOP/background modes. Available modes: "home" (home/desktop background), "work" (work background with app icons), "quiet" (minimal peaceful background), and "create" (Creation Engine workspace). When user says "home mode" or "desktop home", use "home". When user says "work mode" or "desktop work", use "work". When user says "quiet mode", "go quiet", or anything similar, use "quiet". When user says "create mode", "creation mode", "open create mode", "switch to create", or anything similar about building/creating, use "create". IMPORTANT: This is NOT note privacy mode. If the user is talking about Notes/Notepad "personal" vs "work" visibility, use bot_switch_note_mode instead.

mode.description: The desktop mode to switch to. Valid values: 'home' (home/desktop background), 'work' (work background with app icons - aka workspace), 'quiet' (personal quiet background), or 'create' (Creation Engine workspace). REQUIRED - always provide this parameter.

bot_switch_note_mode.name: bot_switch_note_mode
bot_switch_note_mode.description: Switch the note view between different modes (e.g., 'work' for shared, 'personal' for private).

mode.description: The mode to switch to: 'work' (shared) or 'personal' (private)

bot_think_deeply.name: bot_think_deeply
bot_think_deeply.description: Connect to your full OpenClaw brain for tasks that need results spoken back to the user. This is your gateway to: sending Discord/Telegram messages, web research, file access, deep analysis, and any capability beyond your built-in PearlOS tools. Use this when the user asks you to: send a Discord message, search the web, look something up, do complex reasoning, or anything requiring your OpenClaw backend. The result is returned synchronously and you can speak it back. Examples: 'send a message to #general on Discord saying hello', 'search the web for latest news about X', 'what's in my recent emails'. Do NOT use for simple PearlOS operations (notes, YouTube, calculator) — use built-in tools for those.

question.description: The question or problem that requires deep thinking.

bot_update_html_applet.name: bot_update_html_applet
bot_update_html_applet.description: Update an existing HTML applet's metadata or HTML content, identified by its applet_id. If the user wants to update using a note (e.g. 'update with my Space War Tweaks note'), you MUST provide the 'note_title' or 'note_id' parameter so the system can fetch the full content. Do NOT try to summarize the note yourself in the modification_request.

applet_id.description: ID of the applet to update

title.description: Title of the applet to update (used if applet_id is not provided)

new_title.description: New title for the applet (optional rename)

modification_request.description: Natural language description of how to modify the applet (e.g., 'change the background to blue', 'add a score counter'), OR if the user wants you to use a note to help update the applet, put the contents of the note here verbatim.

note_id.description: The ID of the note to use for the update (if applicable)

note_title.description: The title of the note to use for the update (if applicable)

bot_update_user_profile.name: bot_update_user_profile
bot_update_user_profile.description: Save or update user profile when learning new information (upsert pattern - works for both new and existing profiles). TRIGGER PHRASES - When user says: 'I like/love/enjoy X' → save under 'interests'. 'I work at/on X' → save under 'work'. 'My name is X' → save under 'name'. 'I'm from X' → save under 'location'. 'I have X hobby/pet' → save under 'hobbies' or 'pets'. 'I prefer X' → save under 'preferences'. 'I've been doing X lately' → save under 'recent_activities'. EXAMPLES: User says 'I love hiking' → save {'interests': 'hiking'}. User says 'I work at Microsoft' → save {'work': 'Microsoft'}. User says 'I have two dogs' → save {'pets': 'two dogs'}. User says 'I prefer coffee over tea' → save {'preferences': 'coffee'}. Use descriptive keys like 'interests', 'work', 'hobbies', 'family', 'pets', 'goals', 'preferences', 'recent_projects', 'recent_activities'. Call this IMMEDIATELY after learning something new about the user. Works for both new profiles and existing ones.

parameters.description: Profile fields to save or update (e.g., {"pets": "two dogs", "interests": "hiking"})

bot_upgrade_user_access.name: bot_upgrade_user_access
bot_upgrade_user_access.description: Upgrade a user's access level for the current shared resource (note or applet) to read-write. Use this when the user asks to give someone more access, make them a writer, editor, collaborator, upgrade their permissions, or let them edit. Examples: 'upgrade Bill to read-write', 'give Sarah edit access', 'make John a collaborator', 'let Alice write to this note'.

user_email.description: Email address of the user to upgrade

user_name.description: Name of the user (used if email not available)

resource_title.description: Title of the note or applet (optional - if not provided, uses the currently active resource)

resource_id.description: ID of the note or applet (optional - preferred if you have the ID)

bot_wonder_canvas_add.name: bot_wonder_canvas_add
bot_wonder_canvas_add.description: Add HTML content to a Wonder Canvas layer without replacing existing content.

bot_wonder_canvas_animate.name: bot_wonder_canvas_animate
bot_wonder_canvas_animate.description: Trigger a CSS animation on an element in the Wonder Canvas. Reference elements by CSS selector or element id.

selector.description: CSS selector or element id (prefixed with #) to animate.

bot_wonder_canvas_avatar_hint.name: bot_wonder_canvas_avatar_hint
bot_wonder_canvas_avatar_hint.description: Send a mood hint to Pearl's avatar so her visual expression matches the Wonder Canvas scene. Use this to coordinate avatar emotion with what's on screen — e.g., 'dramatic' for a spooky story, 'excited' for a reveal, 'curious' for a mystery.

hint.description: Mood hint for the avatar expression.

bot_wonder_canvas_clear.name: bot_wonder_canvas_clear
bot_wonder_canvas_clear.description: Clear the Wonder Canvas. Specify a layer to clear just that layer, or omit to clear everything.

layer.description: Layer to clear. Omit to clear all layers.

bot_wonder_canvas_scene.name: bot_wonder_canvas_scene
bot_wonder_canvas_scene.description: Display an interactive HTML micro-experience on the Wonder Canvas. Push HTML directly — no AI generation round-trip. Great for stories, choices, quizzes, visual moments, reveals. Add data-action='action_id' to any clickable element; when the user taps it you receive the action_id as a context event. Use the wonder-choice class for styled interactive buttons. Built-in CSS: wonder-fadeIn, wonder-slideUp, wonder-bounce, wonder-shake, wonder-pulse, wonder-glow, wonder-typewriter, wonder-particles-sparkle, wonder-particles-snow, wonder-particles-fireflies. ICONS: Use {{icon:name}} placeholders for inline SVG icons — they are auto-resolved. Available: tree, cave, tower, mountain, castle, sparkle, run, sword, shield, bow, wand, crystal, gem, potion, scroll, key, chest, heart, star, zap, flame, trophy, coin, dragon, wolf, sun, moon, cloud, arrowUp, arrowDown, arrowLeft, arrowRight, check, x, plus, minus. Add CSS classes: {{icon:star:w-icon--lg w-icon--glow}}. Sizes: w-icon--sm/md/lg/xl. Effects: w-icon--glow, w-icon--spin, w-icon--pulse. Example: <button class='wonder-choice'>{{icon:tree}} Enter Forest</button>. DO NOT use emoji characters — they render as boxes in the canvas.

html.description: HTML content to display. Use data-action='id' on interactive elements. Use {{icon:name}} placeholders for inline SVG icons instead of emoji.

css.description: Optional extra CSS styles for this scene.

layer.description: Which layer to render on. Default: main.
